definitions: distinguishing attribute or characteristic that defines something's nature or value
degree of excellence or superiority compared to a standard
essential or distinctive characteristic that makes something what it is
examples: The quality of her work always exceeded expectations
Customer service quality determines brand reputation significantly
These products meet the highest quality standards internationally
The restaurant maintains consistent quality across all locations
Honesty is a quality that everyone should cultivate
The unique quality of her voice captivated audiences

definitions: process of expressing or measuring something in numerical or quantitative terms
logical operation that specifies the quantity of individuals to which a predicate applies
examples: Quantification of environmental damage requires complex methodological approaches
The study focused on quantification of customer satisfaction levels
Universal quantification states that something applies to all members
Existential quantification asserts existence of at least one instance

definitions: word or phrase that indicates quantity or amount in language
symbol or expression in logic that specifies the quantity of a statement
examples: Common quantifiers include 'all', 'some', and 'many' in sentences
The quantifier 'few' suggests a small but unspecified number
The universal quantifier is represented by the symbol âˆ€
Existential quantifiers are fundamental in predicate logic systems

definitions: specific or indefinite amount or number of something measurable
large amount of goods bought or produced at one time
examples: The quantity of rainfall affects crop yields significantly
Scientists measured the quantity of chemicals in the sample
Buying in quantity often results in significant cost savings
The warehouse stores large quantities of seasonal merchandise

definitions: smallest discrete unit of any physical property in quantum mechanics
required or significant amount or quantity of something
examples: Energy exists in discrete quanta at the subatomic level
Quantum mechanics revolutionized our understanding of particle physics
The project requires a quantum of faith and investment
Each shareholder received their quantum of the settlement

definitions: enforced isolation to prevent spread of disease or contamination
temporary isolation of computer files suspected of containing malware
examples: The ship remained in quarantine for fourteen days
Travelers from affected areas faced mandatory quarantine requirements
The antivirus software placed suspicious files in quarantine
Email attachments were held in quarantine pending security checks

definitions: angry argument or disagreement between people, often about trivial matters
short heavy arrow or bolt used with a crossbow
examples: Their quarrel over household chores lasted several days
The siblings' quarrel disrupted the entire family gathering
Medieval soldiers loaded quarrels into their crossbows carefully
The museum displayed ancient quarrels alongside period weapons

definitions: open excavation from which stone or minerals are extracted
animal or person being hunted or pursued by predator
examples: The limestone quarry supplied materials for local construction
Workers extracted marble from the ancient quarry site
The detective pursued his quarry through crowded city streets
The hawk circled above its unsuspecting quarry below

definitions: process or business of extracting stone or minerals from quarries
examples: Quarrying has been the town's main industry for centuries
Modern quarrying techniques minimize environmental impact significantly

definitions: unit of liquid capacity equal to quarter gallon or two pints
examples: The recipe calls for one quart of chicken broth
She bought a quart of milk from the corner store

definitions: one of four equal parts into which something is divided
period of three months in business or academic calendar
distinct district or section of a town or city
coin worth twenty-five cents in North American currency
living accommodation, especially for military personnel or servants
examples: Cut the apple into quarters for easier sharing
She completed three quarters of her assigned work
Sales increased significantly during the third quarter
The academic quarter system divides the year differently
The historic quarter attracts thousands of tourists annually
Artists congregate in the city's bohemian quarter regularly
Insert two quarters into the parking meter please
The vending machine only accepts quarters and dollars
Officers resided in the military quarters near headquarters
Servants' quarters were located behind the main house

definitions: player who directs offensive play in American football team
examples: The quarterback threw a perfect touchdown pass
Their star quarterback suffered an injury during practice

definitions: match or round in competition preceding the semifinal stage
examples: They advanced to the quarterfinals after defeating Spain
The quarterfinal matches will be played next weekend

definitions: act of dividing something into four parts or quarters
division of heraldic shield into four or more sections
examples: The quartering of troops in civilian homes caused resentment
Quartering the pie ensures everyone gets an equal portion
The family crest showed quartering from both ancestral lines
Heraldic quartering displays multiple coats of arms together

definitions: magazine or journal published four times per year
occurring or produced four times per year at regular intervals
examples: The academic quarterly features peer-reviewed research articles
She subscribes to several literary quarterlies for inspiration
The company releases quarterly earnings reports to shareholders
Quarterly meetings ensure regular communication between departments

definitions: military officer responsible for supplies, provisions, and quarters
naval petty officer responsible for navigation and ship steering
examples: The quartermaster distributed supplies to all battalion units
Regiment quartermasters managed equipment and accommodation logistics efficiently
The quartermaster maintained the ship's compass and charts
During storms, the quartermaster never left the helm

definitions: group of four musicians performing together as ensemble
any group or set of four people or things
examples: The string quartet performed Mozart at the wedding
She plays violin in a professional chamber quartet
The detective quartet solved crimes throughout the series
A quartet of friends started the successful business

definitions: hard crystalline mineral composed of silicon and oxygen atoms
examples: The geologist identified several quartz formations in the cave
Rose quartz jewelry has become increasingly popular recently

definitions: concrete or stone platform alongside water for loading and unloading ships
examples: Fishing boats lined up along the harbor quay
Tourists strolled along the quay enjoying waterfront restaurants

definitions: female ruler of independent state, especially hereditary sovereign
most powerful piece in chess able to move any direction
playing card bearing picture of queen, ranking below king
reproductive female in colony of bees, ants, or termites
male performer dressed in elaborate female costume for entertainment
examples: The queen addressed parliament during the state opening
Queen Elizabeth II reigned for over seventy years
She captured the opponent's queen in three moves
Protecting your queen is crucial in chess strategy
He held three queens in his poker hand
The queen of hearts appeared in the fortune reading
The queen bee lays thousands of eggs each season
Worker bees protect their queen at all costs
The drag queen performed stunning lip-sync routines nightly
Famous queens competed in the international pageant competition

definitions: umbrella term for sexual and gender minorities who are not heterosexual or cisgender
something strange, odd, or differing from conventional expectations
examples: The queer community celebrates diversity and inclusion annually
Many identify as queer rather than using specific labels
There was something queer about the abandoned building
He noticed a queer smell coming from the basement

definitions: act of suppressing or putting an end to rebellion or unrest
examples: The quelling of protests required diplomatic intervention strategies
Historical accounts describe the violent quelling of uprisings

definitions: act of satisfying thirst or extinguishing fire completely
rapid cooling of heated metal to increase hardness
examples: Nothing beats cold water for quenching summer thirst
The quenching of the forest fire took three days
Steel quenching produces harder, more durable metal products
Proper quenching techniques prevent metal warping and cracking

definitions: question or request for information about something specific
request for data or information from database or system
examples: She submitted a query about her application status
Customer service handles hundreds of queries every day
The database query returned thousands of matching records
Complex queries can slow down system performance significantly

definitions: long or arduous search for something important or valuable
medieval expedition undertaken by knight to achieve noble goal
examples: Scientists continue their quest for renewable energy solutions
Her quest for knowledge led to groundbreaking discoveries
Knights embarked on quests to prove their valor
The quest for the Holy Grail inspired countless stories

definitions: sentence worded or expressed to elicit information or response
matter requiring resolution or expressing doubt about something
problem or exercise designed to test knowledge or understanding
examples: She asked an interesting question during the lecture
The reporter prepared tough questions for the interview
The question of funding remains unresolved this quarter
There's no question about his commitment to excellence
The exam included fifty multiple-choice questions today
Students struggled with the essay questions particularly

definitions: process of asking questions to obtain information or clarification
showing doubt or uncertainty about something through inquiry
examples: Police questioning of witnesses continued throughout the night
Her persistent questioning revealed important overlooked details
His questioning attitude challenged established scientific theories
The questioning look on her face suggested skepticism

definitions: written set of questions designed to gather information from respondents
examples: Participants completed the health questionnaire before treatment began
The marketing questionnaire helped identify customer preferences effectively

definitions: line of people or vehicles waiting for something
data structure processing elements in first-in-first-out order
examples: The queue outside the store stretched around the block
People joined the queue for concert tickets early
The print queue contained dozens of pending documents
Messages entered the processing queue for sequential handling

definitions: tender sensitive flesh beneath fingernails or surrounding area
examples: She accidentally cut into the quick while trimming nails
The injury reached the quick causing considerable pain

definitions: first movements of fetus felt by pregnant woman
process of becoming faster, more active, or more intense
examples: She felt the baby's quickening around eighteen weeks
The quickening movements reassured her about the pregnancy
The quickening pace of technological change challenges businesses
Economic quickening signals recovery from the recent recession

definitions: something done or made quickly, especially without usual formality
examples: They had a quickie lunch between important meetings
The couple opted for a quickie wedding in Vegas

definitions: loose wet sand that yields easily to pressure and engulfs objects
examples: The explorer nearly disappeared into the deadly quicksand
Warning signs marked quicksand areas throughout the marsh

definitions: liquid metallic element mercury, especially in its fluid state
examples: Old thermometers contained quicksilver before safety regulations changed
The quicksilver moved like liquid metal across surfaces

definitions: informal British term for one pound sterling currency
lump of tobacco for chewing
examples: The drink costs five quid at most pubs
He lent me twenty quid until payday arrives
Sailors often chewed quids during long ocean voyages
The old farmer kept a quid in his cheek

definitions: absence of noise or bustle creating peaceful atmosphere
period of inactivity or tranquility in normally busy situation
examples: The library maintains strict quiet during study hours
She enjoyed the quiet of early morning walks
After the storm came an eerie quiet throughout town
The quiet before battle made soldiers increasingly nervous

definitions: large feather, especially from goose, used as writing instrument
sharp defensive spine of porcupine or hedgehog
examples: Medieval scribes wrote manuscripts using sharpened quills daily
The quill and inkwell sat ready on the desk
The porcupine raised its quills when threatened suddenly
Removing quills from dogs requires veterinary care immediately

definitions: warm bed covering made of padding enclosed between decorative fabric layers
examples: Grandmother's handmade quilt became a treasured family heirloom
The patchwork quilt displayed intricate traditional patterns beautifully

definitions: process or art of making quilts through stitching layers together
examples: She learned quilting from her mother's patient instruction
The quilting bee brought neighborhood women together monthly

definitions: hard acidic pear-shaped fruit used primarily for preserves and jellies
examples: The quince tree produced abundant fruit this autumn
She made delicious quince jelly using grandmother's recipe

definitions: bitter alkaloid from cinchona bark used to treat malaria and fever
examples: Quinine tablets helped control malaria in tropical regions
Tonic water contains small amounts of quinine flavoring

definitions: nutritious seed from South American plant eaten as grain substitute
examples: Quinoa provides complete protein for vegetarian diets effectively
She prepared quinoa salad with fresh Mediterranean vegetables

definitions: most perfect or typical example of quality or class
examples: Her performance was the quintessence of theatrical excellence
This wine represents the quintessence of regional winemaking

definitions: group of five musicians performing together as ensemble
any group or set of five people or things
examples: The jazz quintet performed at the downtown club
A brass quintet entertained guests during the reception
The quintet of friends traveled across Europe together
A quintet of novels completed the fantasy series

definitions: quantity or number that is five times as great as another
examples: The investment yielded quintuple returns within five years
Population growth reached quintuple the projected estimates unexpectedly

definitions: clever, witty remark or comment, often spontaneous and amusing
examples: His quip about politics drew laughter from everyone
She always had a quip ready for any situation

definitions: peculiar behavioral habit or strange aspect of personality or character
examples: Her quirk of arranging books by color amused visitors
Everyone has quirks that make them uniquely interesting

definitions: portable case for holding arrows, typically worn by archers
slight trembling movement or shake
examples: The archer's quiver held twenty perfectly balanced arrows
She crafted a leather quiver using traditional methods
A quiver of excitement ran through the audience
The leaf showed a slight quiver in the breeze

definitions: brief test of knowledge, typically with simple questions
game or competition involving answering questions
examples: Students took a surprise quiz on yesterday's lesson
The weekly quiz helps reinforce important concepts effectively
The pub quiz attracts teams every Tuesday night
Television quiz shows remain popular entertainment worldwide

definitions: minimum number of members required to conduct official business
examples: The meeting lacked quorum so no votes occurred
Board decisions require a quorum of seven members
